## JsPlumbInstance.\_applyRotations() method

Applies the given set of Rotations to the given point, and returns a new PointXY. For internal use.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
_applyRotations(point: [number, number, number, number], rotations: Rotations): RotatedPointXY;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  point | \[number, number, number, number\] | Point to rotate |
|  rotations | Rotations | Rotations to apply.  |

<b>Returns:</b>

RotatedPointXY
